Eubanks Intermediate Staff Member Tests Positive for COVID-19.

Carroll ISD has been notified that a staff member who worked at EIS this week has been lab-confirmed to have COVID-19. Due to privacy requirements, we cannot release the name of the individual or details that may identify him or her, but the information has been provided to Tarrant County Public Health.

CISD worked closely with the local health department on this case, and it has been determined that six individuals are considered “close contacts” to the COVID-positive person. A quarantine plan has already been communicated to the individuals and/or the parents of those identified as close contacts.

The area where the staff member worked will be thoroughly disinfected this evening.

If you begin experiencing any of these symptoms in a way that is not typical, we encourage you to stay home and contact your physician. If at any time you are lab-confirmed to have COVID-19 or a member of your family is lab-confirmed for COVID-19, you must contact Carroll ISD.

With only about half of our parents completing Annual Student Verification (ASV) so far, Carroll ISD is offering a sneak peek at the number of students enrolled for In-Person Instruction and the Dragon Virtual Academy by grade level and campus for the 2020-2021 school year.

The deadline for parents to complete Annual Student Verification is 4:30 p.m. Tuesday, August 4. CISD will update the numbers daily to keep parents informed. When ASV closes, CISD will begin using this information for scheduling and staffing purposes.

Parents who have completed Annual Student Verification but wish to change the instructional platform for their child may submit their request in writing to the campus principal by 4:30 p.m. Monday, August 10. As our nation commemorates Juneteenth, Carroll ISD recognizes that this day of celebration also brings much sorrow. We stand in solidarity with our families of color against racial discrimination and injustice.

We have heard our minority students and families loud and clear and understand that we must do more to build an inclusive culture that values and respects each other’s differences. Racism and bigotry, hate and intolerance are still too present in the world and in our local community and schools.

Carroll ISD is committed to the work of creating a more welcoming, safe, and inclusive environment, free from bullying and harassment, and invites you to learn more about our efforts in progress.

Michelle Moore, School Board President
Pam Francis and Eric Ransom,
District Diversity Council Co-Chairs
Dr. David J. Faltys, Superintendent

Carroll ISD would like to make you aware of companies who falsely represent themselves as selling Carroll Dragon sponsorships. They are "selling" football season now, but will follow in a few months to promote volleyball or basketball. Be a smart Dragon and don't be misled!
